info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Pender and southeastern Bladen Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Point Caswell, or 15 miles southwest of Burgaw, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burgaw, Penderlea, Point Caswell, Long Creek, Montague, Rooks, Malpass Corner, Currie, Wards Corner, The Borough, St. Helena, Atkinson, Watha and Pender Memorial Hospital. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 395 and 404. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
